Description: Seven sherds of Clazomenian black-figure painted pottery neck-amphora reconstructed to form complete vase. Neck, palmette. Body, dots: A, a bearded male figure (Oedipus ?) to right, in long white chiton and himation, confronted by a Sphinx with long hair, beaded fillet, and wings back-to-back; B, two fragments of similar group. Purple for hair and beard of man, upper fillet of sphinx, stripe on forward part of wings, and on necking ring. Incision on white of chitons.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (G), chamber 29
Curator's comments: May join with BM GR 1952,0505.15 - Pl. GB 588, 13. Palmette of type of Pl. GB 589, 2 (GR 1888.2-8.107) (except that the incised marking on the butt is U-shaped). Perhaps Oedipus and the Sphinx, or at least there is no good argument against the identification. JdI 1895, 44 fig. 8. BSA xlvii, 131-CII.14.
Findspot number '29' is pencilled and scratched on the item
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B122)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 593, 3-4)
Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (pl. xxx, 1)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 167)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.119, p.120, fig.8, p.123)
